text: is a railway station in the city of Agano, Niigata, Japan, operated by East Japan Railway Company (JR East). ==Lines== Kamiyama Station is served by the Uetsu Main Line, and is 13.9 kilometers from the terminus of the line at Niitsu Station. ==Station layout== Platform, May 2020 The station consists of one ground-level side platform serving a single bi-directional track. The station is unattended. ==Adjacent stations== ==History== Kamiyama Station opened on 28 September 1944 as a signal stop. It was elevated to a full station on 20 January 1955. With the privatization of Japanese National Railways (JNR) on 1 April 1987, the station came under the control of JR East. ==Surrounding area== The station is located in a rural area, surrounded by rice fields.
